title: The World at war. - Volume 12.
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Hiroshima (Japan) - Bombardment, 1945
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945
description: Episode number 12 of Series "The World at war". Part 24: "The Bomb" The world's first atomic bomb was dropped on the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Four days later a second bomb was dropped on Nagasaki. Part 25: "Reckoning" The end of the war in Central Europe is a time without pity. It is also untidy and messy. The intervention of outsiders from Russia and America means that no European nation can win. Part 26: "Remember" - in the Second World War twenty million Russians died - in action, in captivity, fighting men and women, and ordinary civilians killed in bombing raids. Germany, in the war she started, lost nearly five million dead, and two and a half million Japanese died. America - not invaded or bombed - lost nearly three hundred thousand men. Also available on DVD [318989].
